version_description:
When live music dips its toes in 3D, ridiculous things tend to happen. See Amon Tobin’s Isam, Kraftwerk at the Tate, the reincarnation of 2Pac. Well, following suit, kinda, we’re playing around with 3D touch in Songkick push notifications.

With your next ‘Tickets on sale’ alert, apply appropriate force and check out the shiny new functionality. We could roll this out much further, so please let us know if you’re into it! Find us at @songkick, we’re all ears.

When live music dips its toes in 3D, ridiculous things tend to happen. See Amon Tobin’s Isam, Kraftwerk at the Tate, the reincarnation of 2Pac. Well, following suit, kinda, we’re playing around with 3D touch in Songkick push notifications.

With your next ‘Tickets on sale’ alert, apply appropriate force and check out the shiny new functionality. We could roll this out much further, so please let us know if you’re into it! Find us at @songkick, we’re all ears.

Today we’re talking about artist photos. We’re not, unfortunately, explaining the risks involved in striding into a field of long grass for your band’s press shot. We are, however, giving a cursory mention to artist images in the app, which now load a bit quicker, with some animation thrown in for good measure. As always, hit us up at @songkick with thoughts and feelings!

We spent our Friday scrambling - along with the rest of the tristate area - for LCD Soundsystem tickets. Which is to say that today’s update is a little light. Still, we’ve squashed some juicy bugs, and lined up a bunch of cool stuff for the weeks ahead. As ever, hit us up at @songkick with feedback!

We spent our Friday scrambling - along with the rest of the tristate area - for LCD Soundsystem tickets. Which is to say that today’s update is a little light. Still, we’ve squashed some juicy bugs, and lined up a bunch of cool stuff for the weeks ahead. As ever, hit us up at @songkick with feedback!

Whether you’re pulling in artists from your Spotify or your Facebook we’ve done some tinkering to make sure the connection always works well. We’ve brought some color back into our concert pages. And for those of you who were wondering 'where is that search cursor'? Here it is! As ever, hit us up at @songkick with feedback!

Whether you’re pulling in artists from your Spotify or your Facebook we’ve done some tinkering to make sure the connection always works well. We’ve brought some color back into our concert pages. And for those of you who were wondering 'where is that search cursor'? Here it is! As ever, hit us up at @songkick with feedback!

There are two types of concert buddy. There’s you - the buddy who discovers the show (through Songkick), books the tickets (through Songkick), and generally makes the whole thing look like a piece of cake. Then there’s the buddy who rocks up on the night of the show and asks, in awe, how the heck you managed to get tickets. With this update, we’re restoring the cosmic balance. Head to the More screen, tap the new ‘Share this app’ button and drag your concert buddies out of the dark and into the light.

You’re sat at the pub catching up with friends, and the cool one with the jazzy shirt asks what shows you’ve got lined up for the next few weeks. Do you a) recite from memory as best you can, b) give a live walkthrough of your Songkick plans and pray they remember, or c) use the shiny new ‘Share plans’ button to shoot said friend an SMS with your prized concert calendar enclosed? Well, we know what we’d do.

You’re sat at the pub catching up with friends, and the cool one with the jazzy shirt asks what shows you’ve got lined up for the next few weeks. Do you a) recite from memory as best you can, b) give a live walkthrough of your Songkick plans and pray they remember, or c) use the shiny new ‘Share plans’ button to shoot said friend an SMS with your prized concert calendar enclosed? Well, we know what we’d do.

Do you want to be able to quickly access all of your tracked artists? Of course you do! That’s why we've changed our artist screen to help you do just that. And whether you're at home or away we want to help you find concerts. So next time you’re on holiday make sure you open the app and we'll sort you out. As always, tell us what you think - we’re @songkick.

Where are your plans? Oh. There they are! With this release we've highlighted where your plans are and how to share them with your friends. And while we're talking about friends why not give them a chance to find out about awesome gigs? We've made inviting friends super simple so you can discover new concerts through them. We love feedback so drop us a line @songkick

Some things in life are absolute. The hotter this office gets, for instance, the more of us you’ll finding hiding on the Red Lion rooftop. And the more artists and events you track on Songkick, the harder it is to miss out on epic shows. Hard facts. That’s why we’re kicking off some sweet UX improvements, making those all-important tracking buttons clearer, more intuitive and more useful. If you have any feedback, do please hit us up at @songkick!

Law of averages says that if you’re screenshotting a concert in the app, it’s a very very very good one. Which means you’re freaking out. The adrenaline’s flying, you’re a trembling wreck - this needs to get in WhatsApp, like, right now, but your fingers are failing. Aha! Say howdy to one-tap sharing, whenever you screenshot a concert. Snap, share, done. Now you’re free to lose your shhh unreservedly.

We’re channelling the old proverb; if an app gets updated with no user facing changes, does it make a sound? Maybe the slow, disappointed sigh of a release notes reader, but otherwise probably not. Lots of fun stuff happening under the hood, we promise.

We all have those playlists and compilation albums with somewhat questionable artists - there’s no shame in it. So to keep your concert calendar full of only the most relevant concerts, we’ve made it super simple to untrack multiple artists. But be careful, with great power comes great responsibility!

We all have those playlists and compilation albums with somewhat questionable artists - there’s no shame in it. So to keep your concert calendar full of only the most relevant concerts, we’ve made it super simple to untrack multiple artists. But be careful, with great power comes great responsibility!

What do we want? More concerts. Where do we want them? In the Concerts tab, obviously. Yeah, ok, well today we’re rolling out a shiny new design for your Concerts tab. The date for each show now lives snugly in each concert row, meaning you can a) actually gauge when each event is taking place and b) fit more beautiful concerts on your iPhone screen. Let us know what you think! We’re all ears at @songkick.

What do we want? More concerts. Where do we want them? In the Concerts tab, obviously. Yeah, ok, well today we’re rolling out a shiny new design for your Concerts tab. The date for each show now lives snugly in each concert row, meaning you can a) actually gauge when each event is taking place and b) fit more beautiful concerts on your iPhone screen. Let us know what you think! We’re all ears at @songkick.

Have you ever had a squeaky door? It's not really broken but it could work better. Well this release we've oiled the proverbial hinge so that we can be that bit smoother at making sure you're the first to know when your favourite artists are playing near you.

If the app helps you get to your must-see concerts then please take a second to rate it and give us your feedback. Every day we read every one. #ratersgonnarate

This update falls gracefully into the ’housekeeping’ bucket. We’ve thrown out some old stuff that we just don’t use any more, and added some handy privacy policy and terms of use buttons to our signup screens. Now we can get our GDPR t-shirts printed.
We know that you can’t live without your Spotify. That’s why we’ve made it possible to sign up or log in to the Songkick app with your Spotify account. Enjoy the shiny new Spotify-green button.

New shiny app update for all the eager beavers already on iOS 12! We've squashed some juicy bugs and made sure that it all keeps ticking along, like the well-oiled concert-finding machine you know and love.

We've added type-ahead search, so you can get to those King Gizzard & The Lizard Wizard concerts without triggering your RSI. We've crushed some bugs and sipped some margaritas. More to come, so please shoot feedback and questions to us at @songkick!
Nothing to see here, just some under-the-bonnet bug fixes. Happy gigging!
Like a Daft Punk comeback tour, this update lives just out of sight. Bugs have been crushed and bricks have been laid, so hold tight for shiny new things coming soon.

A mini update, packed with mixed emotions. On the one hand, we're fast running out of interesting (and uninteresting) ways to say 'bug fixes'. On the other, we're super, crazy excited for you to see all the cool stuff we've been working on. So hold tight, and have faith. Talk soon.

Ah, humble concert page. Provider of event details, font of ticket links - you've always been there, and we really owe you one. So here, just for you, a fly new ticket link design. And how about a bundle of similar events, too?! Aw yeah, looking good concert page!

Whether you go to 1 or 100 concerts a year, finding live music should easy. Like, really easy. With today's update, we're lifting the lid on all the best shows in your area - the bands you love, and those you're destined to fall for - to make your Concerts tab a dependable banquet of discovery. Take a look around and let us know what you think - we're all ears over at @songkick. More bells and whistles still to come - and a quick shoutout for your concert plans, which have found a cosy new home in the Profile tab.

Ch-ch-ch-ch-changes. We're ringing in the changes for our final update of the year - shuffling things around to make the app easier to use, and the important stuff easier to find. Search has joined the big league with its own tab, so you can easily track artists and discover shows without triggering your RSI. Your tracked artists are now partying with your plans and cities in your Profile tab. And pour one out for Recommended, which makes way for a more plentiful and rewarding Concerts tab. As always, please let us know your thoughts and feelings over at @songkick (thanks to everyone who's written in so far!). And of course: thank you for sticking with us through 2018, we hope you've been to some unforgettable shows! Here's to you. *Clink*
Bugs have been crushed to make the Concerts tab more beautiful and accessible. Keep sending any thoughts and feelings over to us at @songkick, we're all ears. Happy gigging!

There are puppies in the office, so we're gonna have to make this quick. What's new? Tap 'Interested' or 'Going' to add concerts to your plans and you'll now get a friendly reminder each week about the concerts you've got coming up. Swish! We've also crushed some bugs and tidied up a few design bits. Ok, back to the pups.
Nothing to see here, just some under-the-bonnet bug fixes. Happy gigging!

This is a 'help us help you' kinda update. We've added a friendly little nudge to re-scan your music library or Spotify - you might see it every once in a while to help keep your tracked artists up to date! We've also made some light changes under the hood so it's easier to keep track of the concerts you're interested in. All in all, somehow it's now even harder to miss out on concerts! Any thoughts or feedback, we're all ears (as always) over at @songkick.

They say first impressions are important (we weren't Swifties until 1989, but whatever). So, we've updated our onboarding experience, shifting a few screens around to make the process speedier, and adding a humble welcome screen to kickstart the whole thing off. You'll only see it if you're new to Songkick - but if that's you, let us know what you think!

This one goes out to the Songkick freshmen. We've given our onboarding journey some more love - reupholstering our signup and push notification screens. So, if you're discovering the joys of Songkick for the first time, be sure to let us know what you think! As for the rest of you, stay cool out there.

We've been busy the last couple of weeks. Now, you'll be able to set a handy notification just before tickets go on sale to see your fave artist! We hope you never miss out on tickets again. A new shiny bit of tech also means if you've come here from a link on songkick.com, you won't accidentally miss out on tracking that event you're super keen to go to. To top it all off, a couple of lovely people let us know that you couldn't always see venue names on our artist pages, so we've fixed that.
Nothing to see here! We've made some changes under the hood to prepare for some exciting new features - coming to a Songkick app near you.

Salut à tous nos amis français! We’re super proud to announce that we now have a fully-fledged French iOS app. Simply make sure that your device's language is set to French and you’re all good to go! As ever, we always love to hear from you guys, so don’t hesitate to get in touch via the regular channels with any feedback.

Salut à tous nos amis français! We’re super proud to announce that we now have a fully-fledged French iOS app. Simply make sure that your device's language is set to French and you’re all good to go! As ever, we always love to hear from you guys, so don’t hesitate to get in touch via the regular channels with any feedback.

So. Many. Concerts.  We've made it easier to shortlist the shows that catch your eye as you're browsing. In your Concerts tab, you can now mark 'Interested' to events using the shiny new plus icon. We'll add the concert to your plans, remind you when it's coming up and serve up similarly awesome recommendations. Give it a go, and let us know what you think! We're all ears, as always, at @songkick

So. Many. Concerts.  We've made it easier to shortlist the shows that catch your eye as you're browsing. In your Concerts tab, you can now mark 'Interested' to events using the shiny new plus icon. We'll add the concert to your plans, remind you when it's coming up and serve up similarly awesome recommendations. Give it a go, and let us know what you think! We're all ears, as always, at @songkick

So. Many. Concerts.  We've made it easier to shortlist the shows that catch your eye as you're browsing. In your Concerts tab, you can now mark 'Interested' to events using the shiny new plus icon. We'll add the concert to your plans, remind you when it's coming up and serve up similarly awesome recommendations. Give it a go, and let us know what you think! We're all ears, as always, at @songkick

This update falls gracefully into the 'housekeeping' bucket. We've thrown out some old stuff that we just don't use any more, and we've added a shiny new set of attendance buttons to your concert pages.

And in the spirit of housekeeping: if the app helps get you to your must-see concerts then please take a quick sec to rate it and give us your feedback! We all read every review, every day.

Every time you launch the Songkick app, you should expect to see what's fresh and what's new - the stuff even your biggest music nerd friend doesn't know about yet. That's your human right as a music fan in 2019. So, say hi to 'Recently added' shows in your Concerts tab - a shiny new rack of events that are hot off the press, fresh out the oven, quick out of the blocks - and other cliches - for you to browse at leisure. Let us know what you think over at @songkick! And keep an eye out for more new stuff coming soon.

Grab your wellies, it’s festival season (in the Songkick app, at least). You’ll now find a rack of handpicked festivals in your Concerts tab, boasting the best all-dayers and weekenders your tracked artists are playing in the near future through to summer 2020. Take it for a spin and let us know what you think! Oh, and wellies are rain boots, in case that needed translating.
